SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc42
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.view.Dialog

Class CardPickerDialog

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.view.Dialog.Dialog
it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.view.Dialog.CardPickerDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable, Serializable
public class CardPickerDialog extends Dialog implements Observable
Dialog that shows some Cards and lets the User pick one of them. This Dialog supports up to 6 Cards. More than that work too, but the UI will not adapt, so they'll very likely end up outside the screen in smaller screens or zoom levels. The Cards inside this Dialog can be Flipped. This can be enabled by setting "true" in cardsCanBeFlipped. Like other Dialogs, this can be Dismissible (closable by clicking outside it) or not. This behavior is defined by the value of isDismissible. This Dialog asks the User to pick a Card. When a Card is picked, the Dialog will block its inputs and notify all Listeners of the event. It's up to the caller to hide the Dialog, as it's not handled by the Dialog itself. However, the Dialog will ignore inputs after the first pick, to avoid unpredictable behaviors.
See Also:

    • CardPickerDialog

      public CardPickerDialog(String title, boolean isDismissible, boolean cardsCanBeFlipped, GUIController controller)
      Constructor Method
      Parameters:
      title - a String that will be shown at the top of the Dialog, as a Title
      isDismissible - a boolean value that defines if the Dialog can be closed without picking a Card
      cardsCanBeFlipped - a boolean value that specifies if the Cards inside can be flipped or not
      controller - the GUIController that created this Dialog
